item.title: Report E-2024110194
item.description:
Report E-2024110194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 1, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Caroline Environmental Response Team, Inc. (CERT) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing solution and absorbents to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (1) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024110195
item.description:
Report E-2024110195

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: WILSON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 1, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of acetone were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of acetone to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all acetone from the trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.
